item.title: OpenAI is reportedly asking contractors to upload real work from past jobs
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: An intellectual property lawyer says OpenAI is "putting itself at great risk" with this approach.

item.title: Indonesia blocks Grok over non-consensual, sexualized deepfakes
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Indonesian officials said Saturday that they are temporarily blocking access to xAI’s chatbot Grok.

item.title: CES 2026: Everything revealed, from Nvidia’s debuts to AMD’s new chips to Razer’s AI oddities
item.dc:creator: Morgan Little
item.description: CES 2026 is in full swing in Las Vegas, with the show floor open to the public after a packed couple of days occupied by press conferences from the likes of Nvidia, Sony, and AMD and previews from Sunday’s Unveiled event.

item.title: How the Sleepbuds maker, Ozlo, is building a platform for sleep data
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Ozlo Sleepbuds are going to have a big year, with new products, AI features, and more.

item.title: CES 2026 was all about ‘physical AI’ and robots, robots, robots
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo, Anthony Ha, Kirsten Korosec, Sean O'Kane
item.description: After years of chatbots and image generators, AI is finally leaving the screen. At CES 2026, that shift became impossible to ignore.  The annual tech showcase in Las Vegas was dominated by “physical AI” and robotics, from Boston Dynamic’s newly redesigned Atlas humanoid robot to AI-powered ice makers (yes, really). The companies in attendance clearly want consumers […]

item.title: CES 2026: Follow live for the best, weirdest, most interesting tech as this robot and AI-heavy event wraps up
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec, Sarah Perez
item.description: CES 2026, the annual consumer tech conference held in Las Vegas, is here. And lucky for you, we have TechCrunch editors and reporters on the ground to cover the news, scout out the interesting, weird, and relevant (and some not so relevant) tech, and of course the people working on it. AI has been at the center of most of the action, whether it's Nvidia and AMD's announcements or Amazon and Google's push for its use in the physical world. Follow our live updates as we share all the reveals and new hardware as it happens.

item.title: Meta signs deals with three nuclear companies for 6-plus GW of power
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Two smaller companies, Oklo and TerraPower, along with Vistra, a large energy company, just signed agreements with Meta.

item.title: X restricts Grok’s image generation to paying subscribers only after drawing the world’s ire
item.dc:creator: Ram Iyer
item.description: Elon Musk's AI company has restricted Grok's controversial AI image-generation feature to only paying subscribers on X, after the tool invited heated criticism from across the world for letting users generate sexualized images of women and children.

item.title: Anthropic adds Allianz to growing list of enterprise wins
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Anthropic announces its first enterprise deal of 2026, which includes building agents for, and giving Claude code to, Allianz.

item.title: Governments grapple with the flood of non-consensual nudity on X
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom
item.description: For the past two weeks, X has been flooded with AI-manipulated nude images, created by the Grok AI chatbot — and governments around the world are promising to take action.

item.title: OpenAI to acquire the team behind executive coaching AI tool Convogo
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: OpenAI is acquiring the team behind executive coaching AI tool Convogo in an all-stock deal, adding to the firm's M&A spree.

item.title: The most bizarre tech announced so far at CES 2026
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: From an AI panda pet to an anime girl hologram for your desk, here are the wildest products at CES 2026.

item.title: Nvidia’s reportedly asking Chinese customers to pay upfront for its H200 AI chips
item.dc:creator: Kate Park
item.description: Nvidia is now requiring its customers in China to pay upfront in full for its H200 AI chips even as approval stateside and from Beijing remains uncertain.

item.title: Snowflake announces its intent to buy observability platform Observe
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Snowflake is bolstering its data stack to make the platform better suited to the sheer volume of data produced by AI agents.

item.title: Elon Musk’s lawsuit against OpenAI will face a jury in March
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: District Judge Yvonne Gonzalez Rogers said there was evidence suggesting OpenAI’s leaders made assurances that its original nonprofit structure would be maintained. The case will go to trial in March.

item.title: Why this VC thinks 2026 will be ‘the year of the consumer’
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: AI adoption in enterprise is stalling as companies don't know where to start. Vanessa Larco of Premise VC thinks 2026 will be the year of the consumer.

item.title: Gmail debuts a personalized AI Inbox, AI Overviews in search, and more
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Gmail is also bringing several AI features that were previously available only to paid users to all users.

item.title: Former Bolt CEO Maju Kuruvilla’s startup triples to $100M valuation
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Spangle has raised $15 million in a Series A round to expand its AI-generated shopping experiences.

item.title: Google and Character.AI negotiate first major settlements in teen chatbot death cases
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: The settlements are among the first tied to lawsuits accusing AI companies of harming users.

item.title: Ford has an AI assistant and new hands-free BlueCruise tech on the way
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Ford says the new generation of BlueCruise will be 30% cheaper to build than the current technology.
